-----Original Message-----
From: Cumps Jef
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 10/30/01 4:36 AM
Subject: JUnit and static inner test-classes

Hi all,

I've been wondering about using the JUnite test-classes as static inner
classes. Before, I was using my own static inner classes (and framework)
for unit testing my Java-code and recently switched over to JUnit,
mainly because I want to test server side objects using Cactus.

I feel that using inner classes for testing has more advantages than
using
seperate classes. With inner classes you can do "white box" testing (you
can
access private methods and fields), tests are always right beside your
code
and you are somewhat obliged to keep your tests synchronized with your
code
(or at least keep them compilable). And it is no problem to separate
your
tests from your code after compiling, since inner classes are packed in
separate class-files.

MY QUESTION now is: What are the consequences of using inner classes
together with JUnit ??? Is it always possible, are there any
unforseen problems or drawbacks, ... ?? Does someone has any experience
with
this ?

Any comment, tips, samples ... would be really appreciated.

Jef Cumps
EGOVA NV
Belgium
